title: How to Install a Drip Irrigation System

tasks.task: Converting a sprinkler system into a drip irrigation system.
subtasks: Close off all sprinklers on the target system station by removing sprinkler heads and replacing them with caps.
Convert the closest sprinkler head to the garden beds into a system that allows transitioning from PVC piping to drip irrigation tubing.
Install backbone tubing from the sprinkler adapter to garden beds, ensuring proper connections using T-adapters and elbows.
Dig a trench for laying the drip irrigation tubing, unroll the tubing, and cut it to fit around the garden beds.
Attach emitter tubing at specific intervals (12 inches) to the backbone tubing, ensuring proper spacing for even water distribution.
Pin the emitter tubing in place using ground staples to maintain even spacing and secure the system.
Install a filter at the valve location to prevent particle buildup in the system.
Set up a flush mechanism for the filter to clean the system when needed.
Turn on the water supply, flush the system to remove any debris, and inspect the water flow from the emitters.
Adjust the system as necessary and prepare the garden beds for planting.
